channel.title: ScanX – Stocks
channel.description: ScanX stock market news (Full-Text RSS compatible)

item.title: Top News Astec Lifesciences Appoints Milind Bhangaonkar as General Manager-Operations 13 minutes ago Astec Lifesciences Limited has appointed Mr. Milind Bhangaonkar as General Manager-Operations (Site Head) and Senior Management Personnel effective December 15, 2025. The appointment complies with SEBI Listing Regulations and follows the company's Nomination and Remuneration Policy. Mr. Bhangaonkar brings 29.40 years of chemical industry experience with expertise in multi-site operations, business transformation, and strategic expansion across Agrochemical, API-Pharma, and Specialty Chemical domains.
item.description: Top News Astec Lifesciences Appoints Milind Bhangaonkar as General Manager-Operations 13 minutes ago Astec Lifesciences Limited has appointed Mr. Milind Bhangaonkar as General Manager-Operations (Site Head) and Senior Management Personnel effective December 15, 2025. The appointment complies with SEBI Listing Regulations and follows the company's Nomination and Remuneration Policy. Mr. Bhangaonkar brings 29.40 years of chemical industry experience with expertise in multi-site operations, business transformation, and strategic expansion across Agrochemical, API-Pharma, and Specialty Chemical domains.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close Marginally Lower Amid Fog-Related Flight Disruptions 5 hours ago Indian stock markets closed marginally lower on December 15, with Nifty 50 down 0.12% and Sensex down 0.06%. Market breadth was slightly positive with 2,370 stocks advancing and 2,266 declining. InterGlobe Aviation (IndiGo) buzzed due to flight disruptions caused by fog and potential regulatory scrutiny, highlighting challenges in the aviation sector.
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close Marginally Lower Amid Fog-Related Flight Disruptions 5 hours ago Indian stock markets closed marginally lower on December 15, with Nifty 50 down 0.12% and Sensex down 0.06%. Market breadth was slightly positive with 2,370 stocks advancing and 2,266 declining. InterGlobe Aviation (IndiGo) buzzed due to flight disruptions caused by fog and potential regulatory scrutiny, highlighting challenges in the aviation sector.

item.title: Corona Remedies Makes Strong Market Debut with 38% Premium 10 hours ago Corona Remedies, a pharmaceutical company, listed on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) at ₹1,470.00, marking a 38.42% premium over its IPO price of ₹1,062.00. The strong debut reflects positive investor sentiment towards the company and the pharmaceutical sector. This successful listing may boost confidence in upcoming IPOs, particularly in the healthcare space.
item.description: Corona Remedies Makes Strong Market Debut with 38% Premium 10 hours ago Corona Remedies, a pharmaceutical company, listed on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) at ₹1,470.00, marking a 38.42% premium over its IPO price of ₹1,062.00. The strong debut reflects positive investor sentiment towards the company and the pharmaceutical sector. This successful listing may boost confidence in upcoming IPOs, particularly in the healthcare space.

item.title: BGIL Films Withdraws ₹79 Cr Warrant Issue Application 1 hour ago Bgil Films & Technologies Limited has withdrawn its application for BSE's in-principle approval for a ₹79.12 crore convertible equity warrants issue. The decision was made due to prolonged approval delays leading to investor withdrawals. The original proposal involved issuing 5.65 crore warrants at ₹14 each to 74 non-promoter investors. The company plans to explore alternative fund-raising options and may approach the exchange again with new investor commitments.
item.description: BGIL Films Withdraws ₹79 Cr Warrant Issue Application 1 hour ago Bgil Films & Technologies Limited has withdrawn its application for BSE's in-principle approval for a ₹79.12 crore convertible equity warrants issue. The decision was made due to prolonged approval delays leading to investor withdrawals. The original proposal involved issuing 5.65 crore warrants at ₹14 each to 74 non-promoter investors. The company plans to explore alternative fund-raising options and may approach the exchange again with new investor commitments.
